app.name: Áfangastaður
app.legal:
Please carefully read and understand the following terms and conditions before using Áfangastaður (the "Application"). By using the Application, you agree to be bound by these terms and conditions, and you acknowledge that your use of the Application is subject to compliance with applicable laws and regulations. If you do not agree to these terms and conditions, please do not use the Application.

1. Accuracy of Information:

The Application utilizes Google Maps services to provide location-based information and directions. While we strive to provide accurate and up-to-date information, we cannot guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or reliability of the information provided by the Application. You acknowledge that the maps and data provided may not always reflect current conditions, such as road closures, construction, or traffic incidents.

2. Reliance on Information:

You are responsible for exercising your own judgment and discretion when using the information provided by the Application. We do not accept any liability for decisions made based on the information obtained through the Application. You should always exercise caution, follow traffic laws, and be aware of your surroundings when using the Application for navigation or location-related purposes.

1.0.1: Destination markers on the map were still shown despite failing to load image.
Destination markers on the map may fail to open when tapped.
Content cut off on smaller iPhone screens.
Link to directions in Maps failed to open.
Welcome screen for new users was misaligned.

locations.title: Reykjavik
locations.description: The capital and largest city of Iceland, known for its stunning natural surroundings, including geothermal springs, volcanic landscapes, and iconic landmarks. It offers a vibrant cultural scene with museums, galleries, and a thriving music scene. Visitors can enjoy a variety of outdoor activities, from hiking to relaxing in the Blue Lagoon.

locations.title: Kopavogur
locations.description: The second-largest city in Iceland, located in the Reykjavik Capital Region. It offers a strong cultural scene, theaters, art galleries, and a vibrant nightlife. The city's coastal location provides stunning views of the surrounding landscapes and the North Atlantic Ocean.

locations.title: Hafnarfjordur
locations.description: A charming port town in the Reykjavik Capital Region of Iceland, known for its picturesque harbor and vibrant cultural scene. The historic center features colorful houses, quaint streets, and a lively atmosphere. The town hosts various festivals and events celebrating its rich maritime heritage and folklore.

locations.title: Akureyri
locations.description: The largest town in northern Iceland, situated on the shores of the Eyjafjörður fjord. It is often referred to as the 'Capital of the North' and is known for its stunning natural beauty. Akureyri offers a mix of cultural attractions, including museums, galleries, and a botanical garden.

locations.title: Reykjanesbær
locations.description: A municipality in southwestern Iceland, known for its proximity to the Keflavik International Airport and the stunning Reykjanes Peninsula. The town offers a blend of modern amenities and natural beauty, with attractions like the Blue Lagoon geothermal spa and dramatic landscapes.

locations.title: Garðabaer
locations.description: A suburb of Reykjavik, located in the Reykjavik Capital Region. Known for its family-friendly atmosphere and high-quality schools, the town offers various parks, recreational areas, and sports facilities. It's also home to cultural events and community festivals celebrating Icelandic traditions and arts.

locations.title: Mosfellsbaer
locations.description: A municipality in the Reykjavik Capital Region, nestled between the city of Reykjavik and the scenic landscapes of western Iceland. The town offers a peaceful and picturesque setting, with easy access to hiking trails, hot springs, and geological wonders. It's known for its literary history and cultural sites.

locations.title: Akranes
locations.description: A coastal town in western Iceland, situated along the shores of the Faxaflói Bay. Known for its maritime heritage and scenic surroundings, it offers a mix of cultural attractions, including museums, galleries, and historic landmarks. The Akranes Lighthouse, located on a picturesque peninsula, is a popular destination for visitors.

locations.title: Selfoss
locations.description: A charming town in southern Iceland, situated on the banks of the Ölfusá River. Known for its natural beauty, including waterfalls, hot springs, and scenic hiking trails. Selfoss offers a range of cultural activities, such as concerts, art exhibitions, and local festivals. It's also an excellent starting point for exploring the famous Golden Circle route.

locations.title: Sumac Restaurant
locations.description: Inspired by the nostalgic atmosphere of the city of Beirut, Sumac is a place where locals and visitors can enjoy delicious Middle Eastern Cuisine and handcrafted Mediterranean cocktails.
